conclusion: Determine the electric field strength at the point (h, h, -h) due to the induced charges on the conductor.
Electric field due to a point charge +q at a distance r is given by E = k q / r^2 r-hat.
Distance from point A(0, 0, h) to (h, h, -h) is calculated as h√5.
Unit vector r-hat in the direction from A to (h, h, -h) is (1/h√5) (h, h, -h).
Electric field at (h, h, -h) due to the point charge +q is E_point = k q / 5h^3√5 (h, h, -h).
Electric field inside the conductor is zero, total electric field inside must be due to induced charges.
Electric field due to induced charges must cancel out the electric field due to the point charge.
Electric field due to induced charges at (h, h, -h) is E_induced = -E_point = -k q / 5h^3√5 (h, h, -h).
Magnitude of the electric field due to induced charges is k q / 5h^2.
